body:
> Running extract_entities_needs_specialization explicitly after early_sweep_material_instances fixes the leaks.

I'd welcome a fix to add that system ordering constraint as a first step.

repository.name: bevy

issue.body:
# Objective

Plugs one of the holes responsible for leaking memory in #21526. 

## Solution

- Explicit ordering so that instances are cleaned up and the subsequent `SpecializedMaterialViewPipelineCache` cleanup step can happen.

## Testing

Tested with the first example in the issue while printing the size of the maps in `specialize_material_meshes`, i.e.

```rust
        dbg!(entity_specialization_ticks.len());
        dbg!(view_specialized_material_pipeline_cache.len());
```

body: With https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/21410 the first part looks like it's fixed. Now only the second part relating to `NotShadowCaster` components persists.

rename.to: Memory leak in `EntitySpecializationTicks` and `SpecializedMaterialPipelineCache` when a material uses `NotShadowCaster`

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #21526 

## Solution

- Only require specialization when the entity still exists.

## Testing

- Tested with the second example in the issue while printing the size of the `EntitySpecializationTicks`.

body: @alice-i-cecile  Any chance https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/21599 can get into 0.17.3? It builds on https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/21410 which is also in the bugfix milestone.
Yeah, that's a reasonable choice. Swapped the milestones :) We need to find another rendering reviewer though.
